intro: Nassauvia lanata var. lanigera, commonly known as the woolly nassauvia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is characterized by its dense, woolly foliage that gives it a distinctive, fuzzy appearance. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it suitable for arid and semi-arid environments. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its unique texture and seasonal blooming habit.
